metadata.title: Tuesday, 13th October, 2015
metadata.session: FIFTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a)    why the Zambia Postal Services Corporation is retrenching its employees;
(b)    what the total number of employees retrenched as of 8th October, 2015, is;
(c)    how many workers are earmarked for retrenchment;
(d)    whether all the retrenched workers have been paid their retrenchment benefits; and
(e)    who is financing the retrenchment exercise.
(a)    when the culvet, which was washed away, at Mapula Dam in Chembe Parliamentary Constituency will be replaced;
(b)    when the embankment at Mapula Dam will be rehabilitated; and
(c)    what measures have been taken, in the interim, to avert a looming disaster at the Dam.
(a)    when speed humps will be constructed on the Mazabuka-Livingstone Highway at Tandabale in Magoye Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b)    what the cost of the project is.
(a)    when the tarring of the Gwembe-Chipepo road will commence;
(b)    what the name of the contractor for the project is; and
(c)    what the cost of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Agriculture when renovation of houses at the following Agricultural Camps in Chasefu Parliamentary Constituency will commence
parts: (a)    Malandula;
(b)    Munyukwa;
(c)    Mkwalo;
(d)    Khulamayembe; and
(e)    Kamuzowole.
(a)    whether the Government has any plans to re-introduce competence examinations in the civil service to enhance professionalism and efficiency;
(b)    if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c)    if there are no such plans, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    what has caused the delay in completing the street lighting project in Kalabo District;
(b)    what measures have been taken to ensure that the project is completed on time; and
(c)    when the project will be completed.

questions.minister: Minister of General Education when Chimtende and Chisale Schools in Mkaika Parliamentary Constituency will be electrified.

parts: (a)    when construction of a police post at Mungo Lukuta in Chembe Parliamentary Constituency will commence; and
(b)    what security measures have been taken, in the interim, to protect lives and secure property in the area.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport and Communication when the Government will facilitate the erection of a communication tower in Chief Kasimba’s area in Kaoma District.
